medical_history.chief_complaint: 3 days of RUQ pain and nausea without vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days ago when the patient was awoken from sleep at 2AM with severe epigastric and RUQ pain. The pain was worse with movement and was intermittent, not improving over time. The patient also had low-grade fevers (100.0Â°F) but no diarrhea. The last bowel movement was yesterday, and there was no blood. This was the first occurrence of such symptoms despite being aware of having gallstones.
medical_history.past_medical_history: s/p appendectomy, total abdominal hysterectomy (TAH), total thyroidectomy (thyroid cancer).
